context_bundle.summary: Encryption protects data at rest (AES-256) and in transit (TLS 1.3+) using strong cryptography, secure key management with rotation, and proper initialization vectors to prevent unauthorized access per GDPR, HIPAA, PCI DSS requirements.

onboarding.quick_start: Encryption implementation: 1) At rest: Use AES-256-GCM for symmetric encryption with unique IVs. 2) In transit: Enforce TLS 1.3+ with strong cipher suites. 3) Key management: Store keys in vault (AWS KMS, HashiCorp Vault), never hardcode. 4) Rotate keys regularly (90-day cycle). 5) Use HSTS headers for HTTPS enforcement. 6) Disable legacy protocols (SSLv3, TLS 1.0/1.1). Encrypt PII, PHI, payment data always.
common_patterns: AES encryption (Python): from cryptography.fernet import Fernet; key = Fernet.generate_key(); cipher = Fernet(key); encrypted = cipher.encrypt(b'sensitive data'); decrypted = cipher.decrypt(encrypted)

AES-256-GCM: from cryptography.hazmat.primitives.ciphers.aead import AESGCM; key = AESGCM.generate_key(bit_length=256); aesgcm = AESGCM(key); nonce = os.urandom(12); ciphertext = aesgcm.encrypt(nonce, plaintext, associated_data); plaintext = aesgcm.decrypt(nonce, ciphertext, associated_data)

TLS config (Node.js): const https = require('https'); const options = { key: fs.readFileSync('private-key.pem'), cert: fs.readFileSync('certificate.pem'), minVersion: 'TLSv1.3', ciphers: 'TLS_AES_256_GCM_SHA384:TLS_CHACHA20_POLY1305_SHA256' }; https.createServer(options, app).listen(443)
HSTS header: Strict-Transport-Security: max-age=31536000; includeSubDomains; preload
Key rotation: def rotate_key(): new_key = generate_key(); old_key = load_current_key(); re_encrypt_data(old_key, new_key); store_key(new_key); archive_old_key(old_key)
